intro: Agoseris heterophylla var. heterophylla, commonly known as the variable agoseris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate, lanceolate leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. The species is known for its variable leaf morphology, which contributes to its common name.
